utterances.utterance: You refer to yourself as a crazy blue sky's thinker. And in fact, there was a character based on you-- HILTON That's right.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: -- in a TV show. HILTON It was the precursor actually to the show Veep. That's done very well over here. It's the same people and the same kind of thing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yes! My, God, that is so great for me!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: And the country?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's what I meant.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: Tell us, you now, you went to work at 10 Downing Street bare foot?

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's really weird. The British press, they got fixated on a bunch of things that I thought were just completely normal but they thought we're like just very odd. One of them was I rode my bike in London. You know the traffic is terrible and I rode my bike every day into 10 Downing Street.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: Every single day, the photographers were outside, took a picture of me around the corner on my bike. It's like the same thing every day. Why are you doing this? Maybe I had a different t-shirt on, but it's the same picture. The other thing was the, the inside of 10 Downing Street, if anyone has been there, they will notice it's like a, it's actually literally an old aristocratic house. The downstairs, the cabinet room, the prime minister's office, that's where my office was. You got this plush carpet, and soft, it's very homely actually because it used to be a home. So, I just felt at home. And you would walk around, I would take my shoes off just like you do at home. I never have thought this was really weird. They were reporting on so much that when people came in for meetings, business groups, or outside or other civil servants, or whatever it may be. They would literally I could say they were looking to see if it's true.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: Well, they're very proper people.

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: And they would look and see, has he got a shoes on? And I remember one time doing a like some event, I was addressing a bunch of people in Downing Street some meeting or something, and they literally one of the people said, you've got to take your shoes off, they will be disappointed. They think of you as the no shoes guy. You got to take them off.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: And what TV show based the character on you?

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: That was called the thick of it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Stewart, you're out. You are going to pickled in a think tank.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Of course, I am, Mary Anne. And whose authority is this coming from?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Le Pen (Ph). Whilst acknowledging the need for thoughts, is keen on actions, these days.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: Do did David Cameron ever say to you, you know, Steve, you've got to put on a tie and shirt and a jacket?

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: Never! No. In fact, when I was there, President Obama was in the White House and they all came over for a state visit and I don't think it was the president, but someone, maybe it was David of someone, they saw me wandering around and it was reported back to me that the president said, who is that beach bum?

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: You don't have a cell phone.

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: And you are an anti-tech guy which is something I truly appreciate about you. You're much more courageous than I am. I would love to ditch my phone. How do you communicate without a phone for the last six years?

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: Well, Yes, six years. Pretty much soon after we moved here. Well, it started by accident. It wasn't a plan. I had a phone which is from the government, I had to give it up. I came here. I couldn't find that exact make. So, I just bumbled around and tried various things and then I just got fed up with it. And I realized after a week of not having a phone, not by planning it, I just -- it happened to be a week, I thought, that was actually really great. Give me time to think. And then I gave it up for a few months and then it became a conscious decision. You know, I still use e-mail. I have a laptop. But the point about that, is you can connect when you want to. You can decide.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: So, what you do when you're driving somewhere and you're completely lost and you don't have Google maps and there is no such thing really as pay phones anymore?

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: It's not even easy to find a paper map?

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: So, I do a lot of research. So, I literally I look it up before I go. And I think it makes me much--

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: Like we used to do.

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: I used to do. And I literally draw bits of -- I draw maps and I draw the instructions. I write the instructions on a piece of paper. I think it makes you more aware of where you're going and what you are doing.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: So, have you ever just completely stranded?

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: Sometimes I have to -- I literally have to walk for a mile, literally miles to find, to try to find a hotel or something that may be able to call me. It's cool.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: And you are also a no tech, low tech parent.

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: You have two boys, right, and they have no phones, no computer screens, no nothing.

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: No. I mean, they use computers at school.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: How old are they?

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: They 10 and seven. No, they definitely don't have anything like that. No iPad, no -- I mean, we watch -- we watch things consciously as the years have gone on, I kind of feel like I do want to actively campaign for it. As I see what it's doing to society and parents and the relationship with their kids and so on, I've got more militant about it. So, I think I might start pushing in that direction.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: You're revolutionary.

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: As they say.

utterances.speaker: HILTON
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MACCALLUM
utterances.utterance: There he is. All right. We got another update on these numbers coming from Maricopa, Arizona. Democratic Krysten Sinema is now up by more than 8,000 votes. There are more votes to be counted there, so that one has us on the edge of our seats tonight, as we watch the Senate race in Arizona. Stay tuned for that. That is our story on this Thursday night. Thanks for being with us this evening everybody. Good to have you with us. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
